marketNews.title: SKK Migas targets additional liquefied petroleum gas production
marketNews.content: The Indonesian Ministry of Energy and Mineral Resources (SKK Migas) announced that it targets an additional 1 million tonnes per year of liquefied petroleum gas (LPG) production over the next three to four years to reduce imports. The regulator said it has identified 15 gas fields that could supply the additional output. Currently, Indonesia produces 1.7 million tonnes of LPG per year, while in 2023 the country imported 6.9 million tonnes of LPG from a total of 8.7 million tonnes sold domestically.

marketNews.title: U.S. job openings decline to 7.44 million in September 2024
marketNews.content: The U.S. Bureau of Labor Statistics reported that the number of job openings in the United States fell by 418,000 to 7.44 million in September 2024, down from 7.86 million in August 2024, missing the consensus forecast of 7.99 million and marking the lowest level since January 2021.

marketNews.title: CNGR plans $10 billion battery‑precursor plant in Indonesia
marketNews.content: CNGR Advanced Material Co., the parent of CNGR Indonesia, announced plans to build a battery‑precursor production facility in Indonesia with an investment of US$10 billion. The project will be carried out in three phases over 10‑15 years. The company is currently seeking a suitable location, and potential partners will join after the plant is built.

marketNews.title: Bukalapak to restructure and cut jobs in the next two quarters
marketNews.content: Bukalapak’s Chief Executive Officer, Willix Halim, said the company will undergo a restructuring that will lead to layoffs over the next two quarters. The firm will refocus on its core businesses: the Bukalapak Marketplace, gaming, investment, and a range of retail services.

tickerNews.title: ASII 3Q24: Net Profit Grows Solid, Beats Expectations
tickerNews.content: Astra International (ASII) reported a strong net profit of 10 trillion rupiah in 3Q24, up 21% year‑over‑year (YoY) and 19% quarter‑over‑quarter (QoQ). The result lifted 9‑month net profit to 25.9 trillion rupiah, up 1% YoY and representing 84% of the FY24 consensus estimate. The increase was helped by foreign‑exchange gains and other income totaling 1.7 trillion rupiah (3Q23: 769 billion, 2Q24: 208 billion). Operating profit rose to 10.9 trillion rupiah (+12% YoY, +2% QoQ), making 9‑month operating profit 31.8 trillion rupiah (‑2% YoY) and 80% of the FY24 consensus. The performance was driven by the United Tractors (UNTR) segment and the Financial Services segment. UNTR’s operating profit reached 7.1 trillion rupiah (+29% YoY, flat QoQ) in 3Q24, with 9‑month operating profit of 20.9 trillion rupiah (‑2% YoY). The motor segment outperformed the car segment, with financial‑services operating profit of 2.2 trillion rupiah (+5% YoY, +1% QoQ) in 3Q24 and 6.6 trillion rupiah over 9M24 (+10% YoY). Consumer‑finance grew 9% YoY, driven by motor financing. PT Astra Honda Motor (AHM) posted a 3 trillion‑rupiah net profit in 3Q24 (+17% YoY, +24% QoQ), raising the associate and JV share to 2.7 trillion rupiah (+4% YoY, +15% QoQ). The car segment lagged due to weaker sales volume.

tickerNews.title: BMRI 9M24: Net Profit +7.6% YoY; Loan Growth +20.8% YoY
tickerNews.content: Bank Mandiri (BMRI) reported a net profit of 15.5 trillion rupiah in 3Q24 (+12% QoQ, +12% YoY), bringing 9‑month net profit to 42 trillion rupiah (+7.6% YoY), equal to 76% of the FY24 consensus. Credit cost (CoC) stayed at 0.9% for 9M24 (vs. 1% in 1H24) and better than the FY24 guidance of 1‑1.2%. Management upgraded the FY24 CoC guidance to ≤1%. Credit growth was +20.8% YoY (2Q24: +20.5% YoY), above the FY24 guidance of +16‑18%. Net interest margin for 9M24 was 5.1%, at the low end of the FY24 guidance.

tickerNews.title: BBRI 9M24: Net Profit +5.4% YoY, 11.2% QoQ
tickerNews.content: Bank Rakyat Indonesia (BBRI) posted a net profit of 15.4 trillion rupiah in 3Q24 (+11.2% QoQ, +5.4% YoY), resulting in 9‑month net profit of 45.1 trillion rupiah (+2.4% YoY), equal to 74.2% of the FY24 consensus. The result was driven by a 13.9% YoY increase in pre‑provision operating profit to 90.5 trillion rupiah, a net interest margin of 7.7% (down from 8.1% in 9M23), and a 39.1% YoY rise in non‑interest income. Credit cost rose to 3.39% YoY, mainly from higher cost at PT Permodalan Nasional Madani, while credit growth slowed to +8.2% YoY in 3Q24 (2Q24: +11.2% YoY).

tickerNews.title: TLKM 9M24: Net Profit -12% YoY, +4% QoQ
tickerNews.content: Telkom Indonesia (TLKM) reported a net profit of 5.9 trillion rupiah in 3Q24 (‑12% YoY, +4% QoQ), bringing 9‑month net profit to 17.7 trillion rupiah (‑9% YoY), below the FY24 consensus at 71% of estimate. Operating profit fell to 10.6 trillion rupiah (‑15% YoY, +2% QoQ) due to a 2% decline in revenue and a 4% YoY rise in cost of goods sold. The 9‑month operating profit was 32.4 trillion rupiah (‑7% YoY), 72% of the FY24 consensus. Average revenue per user (ARPU) for the mobile segment fell to 43.1 thousand rupiah (‑11% YoY, ‑4% QoQ) with subscribers slipping to 158.4 million (+0.1% YoY, ‑1% QoQ).

tickerNews.title: PANI 9M24: Net Profit +364% YoY, +24% QoQ
tickerNews.content: Pantai Indah Kapuk Dua (PANI) reported a net profit of 202 billion rupiah in 3Q24 (+364% YoY, +24% QoQ), raising 9‑month net profit to 487 billion rupiah (+91% YoY). Revenue from property‑recognition grew 92% YoY and gross‑margin rose to 59.4% (+750 bps YoY, +550 bps QoQ). Operating expenses stayed 4% lower YoY (+2% QoQ), allowing 3Q24 operating profit of 360 billion rupiah (+215% YoY, +20% QoQ) and 9‑month operating profit of 934 billion rupiah (+45% YoY). Management upgraded the 2024 marketing‑sales target by about 9% to 6 trillion rupiah; 9‑month marketing‑sales reached 4.67 trillion rupiah (+168% YoY), achieving 78% of the new target.

tickerNews.title: ISAT 9M24: Net Profit +30% YoY, -21% QoQ
tickerNews.content: Indosat Ooredoo Hutchison (ISAT) posted a net profit of 1.1 trillion rupiah in 3Q24 (+30% YoY, ‑21% QoQ), resulting in 9‑month net profit of 3.9 trillion rupiah (+39% YoY), equal to 74% of the FY24 consensus. Operating profit was 2.7 trillion rupiah (+13% YoY, ‑6% QoQ), giving a 9‑month operating profit of 8.4 trillion rupiah (+28% YoY) and matching the FY24 consensus at 73% of estimate. Mobile‑segment ARPU fell to 37.2 thousand rupiah (+2% YoY, ‑3% QoQ) with 98.7 million subscribers, down 1% YoY and 2% QoQ.

tickerNews.title: TAPG interim dividend 2024: 1.51 trillion IDR (76 IDR per share)
tickerNews.content: Tripura Agro Persada (TAPG) will distribute an interim dividend for fiscal year 2024 of 1.51 trillion rupiah, or 76 rupiah per share. The dividend is payable on the regular market and on the negotiation market on 7 November 2024, with payment scheduled for 20 November 2024. Based on the closing price of 915 rupiah per share on 30 October 2024, the implied dividend yield is 8.3%.

tickerNews.title: PTBA 9M24: Net Profit +19% YoY, -4% QoQ

tickerNews.content: Tempo & Siberian Sierra (Tempo Scan Pacific) (TSPC) reported a net profit of 262 billion rupiah in 3Q24 (+1% YoY, ‑37% QoQ), resulting in 9‑month net profit of 1.1 trillion rupiah (+14% YoY).
